contents.name: drill
contents.description: Helm Charts for deploying Apache Drill Clusters on Kubernetes
contents.title: Chart

children.value: Overridding the following two Drill configuration files is currently supported:
Please edit/replace them as needed. Please do NOT rename/delete.
Once the above configuration files are ready, please create the

configMap to upload them to Kubernetes. When a Drill chart is deployed, the files contained within this configMap will be downloaded to each container and used by the drill-bit process during start-up.
This project was originally forked from

, but
was moved to this repo for automated build and discoverability.
This repository contains a collection of files that can be used to deploy

on
Kubernetes using Helm Charts. Supports single-node
and

are a packaging format in Helm
that can simplify deploying Kubernetes applications such as Drill Clusters.
A Kubernetes Cluster (this project is tested on a

must be installed to use the charts.
Please refer to Helm's
Once Helm has been set up correctly, add the repo as follows:
If you had already added this repo earlier, run

to retrieve
the latest versions of the packages. You can then run

for providing default values to 'variables' used in the chart templates. These values may
be overridden either by editing the

. For example, such as the namespace,
number of drillbits and more to the
file for details on default values for Drill Helm Charts.

There is a service that can be used, but this one will jump from pod, which isn't very friendly. Depending on ingress
class you can make this sticky with annotations. You could also change the
Drill Helm charts are organized as a collection of files inside the

directory. As Drill depends on Zookeeper for
cluster co-ordination, a zookeeper chart added as dependency in the

. The Zookeeper chart
is maintained by Bitnami.

props.code:
drill/   
  Chart.yaml    # A YAML file with information about the chart
  Chart.lock    # A YAML file containing information about the fetched dependencies
  values.yaml   # The default configuration values for this chart
  charts/       # A directory containing the ZK charts
  templates/    # A directory of templates, when combined with values, will generate valid Kubernetes manifest files
  docs/         # A directory containing files for the documentation

children.value: # A YAML file with information about the chart
# A YAML file containing information about the fetched dependencies
# The default configuration values for this chart
# A directory containing the ZK charts
# A directory of templates, when combined with values, will generate valid Kubernetes manifest files
# A directory containing files for the documentation

which are used to generate Kubernetes manifest files. These are YAML-formatted resource
descriptions that Kubernetes can understand. These templates contain 'variables', values for which are picked up from
the
Drill Helm Charts contain the following templates:

The size of the Drill cluster (number of Drill Pod replicas / number of drill-bits) can not only be manually scaled up
or down, but can also be autoscaled to simplify cluster management. When enabled, with a higher CPU
utilization, more drill-bits are added automatically and as the cluster load goes down, so do the number of drill-bits
in the Drill Cluster. The drill-bits deemed
excessive

,
by going into quiescent mode to permit running queries to complete.
For the graceful shutdown to succeed, a sigfile is made in the

(
uid 0). If the application is run as
Enable autoscaling by editing the autoscale section in
String to partially override common.names.fullname template (will maintain the release name)
String to fully override common.names.fullname template
Drill image tag (immutable tags are recommended)
Number of Drill replicas to deploy
Set the resources for the Drill containers
The resources limits for the Drill containers
The requested memory for the Drill containers
The requested cpu for the Drill containers
Number of seconds after which pods are forcefully killed
Note: Lower values may cause running queries to fail
used for database connection and log timestamps
Enable ingress record generation for Drill
IngressClass that will be used to implement the Ingress (Kubernetes 1.18+)
Additional annotations for the Ingress resource. To enable certificate auto-generation, place here your cert-manager annotations.
Define tls secrets for hosts (implementation not done yet)
Enable creation of ServiceAccount for Drill pod
Additional custom annotations for the ServiceAccount
The name of the ServiceAccount to use.

Configuring Drill can be done with override files or in the web ui, although some properties can only be set in the override file.
When using the web ui, ZooKeeper will be used to store the values. Make sure that the storage of ZooKeeper is persistent if you intend to configure this way.
This is an example where the web ui and authentication for local (plain) users is enabled.
For more options refer to the
JDBC Drivers can be configured to download here. This can be used if the Docker image doesn't contain the correct drivers
The name of the driver, will be used as filename (with
appended) and as name for initContainer
The URL to download the driver from
The name of the configmap, containing configuration files to override
Multiline value for storage-plugins-override.conf Can also be configured in the Web UI and saved by persistent ZooKeeper
Name of the secret containing a passwd file
Users to create on the system
Configures if the user should be admin
Optionally specify extra list of additional volumes for Drill pods
Optionally specify extra list of additional volumeMounts for Drill container(s)
Persistence is used for logging and for JDBC drivers. These can be configured separately.

Configuration for Drill will be saved in ZooKeeper.
Make sure that ZooKeeper is persistent if you want to keep changes in the Web UI.
Enable persistence using Persistent Volume Claims
The name of an existing PVC to use for persistence
Selector to match an existing Persistent Volume for Drill's data PVC
PVC Storage Request for Drill's dedicated data log directory
The name of an existing PVC to use for persistence
Selector to match an existing Persistent Volume for Drill's data log PVC
has been changed. This makes it possible to configure

. This is to default to a less complex install.
Having three replicas introduces some complexity regarding, authentication, logging and how queries will be executed.
Until features have been added to simple this, the user needs to take these things into account.

has changed so storage for logs and data can be configured secretly.
The values for persistent logging are now located at

nameOverride.description: String to partially override common.names.fullname template (will maintain the release name)

fullnameOverride.description: String to fully override common.names.fullname template

tag.description: Drill image tag (immutable tags are recommended)

replicaCount.description: Number of Drill replicas to deploy

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which pods are forcefully killed

timeZone.description: used for database connection and log timestamps

enabled.description: Enable ingress record generation for Drill

className.description: IngressClass that will be used to implement the Ingress (Kubernetes 1.18+)

annotations.description: Additional annotations for the Ingress resource. To enable certificate auto-generation, place here your cert-manager annotations.

tls.description: Define tls secrets for hosts (implementation not done yet)

create.description: Enable creation of ServiceAccount for Drill pod

annotations.description: Additional custom annotations for the ServiceAccount

name.description: The name of the ServiceAccount to use.

drivers.description: JDBC Drivers can be configured to download here. This can be used if the Docker image doesn't contain the correct drivers

existingConfigMap.description: The name of the configmap, containing configuration files to override

storagePlugins.description: Multiline value for storage-plugins-override.conf Can also be configured in the Web UI and saved by persistent ZooKeeper

existingSecret.description: Name of the secret containing a passwd file

users.description: Users to create on the system

extraVolumes.description: Optionally specify extra list of additional volumes for Drill pods

extraVolumeMounts.description: Optionally specify extra list of additional volumeMounts for Drill container(s)

enabled.description: Enable persistence using Persistent Volume Claims

existingClaim.description: The name of an existing PVC to use for persistence

selector.description: Selector to match an existing Persistent Volume for Drill's data PVC

size.description: PVC Storage Request for Drill's dedicated data log directory

existingClaim.description: The name of an existing PVC to use for persistence

selector.description: Selector to match an existing Persistent Volume for Drill's data log PVC

contents.name: openforms2xxllnc
contents.description: A Helm chart for running a Frank! on Kubernetes
contents.title: Chart
🔌Frank!Framework Template Chart
contents.description: This template Helm Chart can be copied as a start point for a new Frank!.

children.value: This template Helm Chart can be copied as a start point for a new Frank!.
This chart won't be published because it is not in the

must be installed to use the charts.  Please refer to
Helm's
Once Helm has been set up correctly, add the repo as follows:
If you had already added this repo earlier, run

to retrieve
the latest versions of the packages.  You can then run
String to partially override common.names.fullname template (will maintain the release name)
String to fully override common.names.fullname template
Frank!Framework image tag (immutable tags are recommended)
Set if the values for the memory are in percentages
Sets the initial size of the heap that will be used by the Frank!Framework
Sets the maximum size of the heap that will be used by the Frank!Framework
side of where the instance is running
Set the secret name of the existing secret
Set the key inside the secret that contains the data (e.g.
Set the name of the Frank! instance (default is the
Set the configurations to load. Leave empty to use the default
Define certificate (key/trust) stores to mount in the resources folder of the Frank!
Name of the secret where the certificate store is located in
The key in the secret where the certificate store is located in
The path to the certificate store in the Resource folder, the key will be used as default value
Set http authentication for the Frank!
Set localUsers who can log in on the Frank!
Set the username of the user
Set the password of the user
Set the roles of the user. Options:
Set baseDn for Active Directory users
Set the transaction manager for Tomcat. Options:
Set Yaml properties for configuring the Frank!Framework or configurations
Set extra environment variables for the Frank!
and possibly overwrite the existing one, to configure the connections/resources.
Set multiple database connections. One connection should have an empty name, so it'll get picked up by default (unless
Name of the connection (leave empty to use default:
Host of where the database can be reached (like in the same cluster e.g.
Port for the database (leave empty for default)

The startup probe will enable blue-green deployment, which are great for uptime during upgrades and such.
It (and the liveness probe) will check if the console is accessible, until a better health endpoint is available.
The readiness probe will check if all adapters are running using the server health endpoint
Number of Frank!Framework replicas to deploy
Toggle probes. This should only be used if a Frank! needs to be kept while in a bad state (for debugging purposes)
Set the resources for the Frank!Framework containers
The resources limits for the Frank!Framework containers
The requested memory for the Frank!Framework containers
The requested cpu for the Frank!Framework containers
Number of seconds after which pods are forcefully killed
Note: Lower values may cause running adapters to fail
used for database connection and log timestamps
Enable ingress record generation for Frank!
IngressClass that will be used to implement the Ingress (Kubernetes 1.18+)
Additional annotations for the Ingress resource. To enable certificate autogeneration, place here your cert-manager annotations.
Define tls secrets for hosts (implementation not done yet)
Enable creation of ServiceAccount for Frank!Framework pod
Additional custom annotations for the ServiceAccount
The name of the ServiceAccount to use.
Persistence is used for keeping heap dumps. They can be found at

with persistence enabled.
Otherwise, they can be found at
Enable persistence using Persistent Volume Claims
The name of an existing PVC to use for persistence
Selector to match an existing Persistent Volume for the Frank!Framework's data PVC
Endpoint at which the zs-dms BeantwoordVraag binding is served.
Endpoint at which the zs-dms OntvangAsynchroon binding is served.
Endpoint at which the zs-dms VrijBericht binding is served.
Root url of the 'Notificaties API' that is used to subscribe at.
Options: 'jwt', 'basic', 'value'. 'value' uses the password field of the given authAlias as Authorization header.
Reference to an auth alias to be used as credentials for this api.
Fully qualified url to the notification callback of openforms2xxllnc.
Reference to an auth alias to be used as authorization key for calling the callback endpoint.
Url of the objecttype to filter the notifications on.
Options: 'jwt', 'basic', 'value'. 'value' uses the password field of the given authAlias as Authorization header.
Reference to an auth alias to be used as credentials for this api.
Options: 'jwt', 'basic', 'value'. 'value' uses the password field of the given authAlias as Authorization header.
Reference to an auth alias to be used as credentials for this api.
Enable connecting to the configured SMTP server/replay.
Connect securely to the SMTP server/relay with SSL.
Reference to an auth alias to be used as credentials for authorizing with the SMTP server/relay.
The default no-reply sender's name that is shown with the no-reply sender's e-mail address.
The default no-reply sender's e-mail address that used when sending e-mails.
The no-reply sender's name used in the signature of the e-mail body.
Options: 'jwt', 'basic', 'value'. 'value' uses the password field of the given authAlias as Authorization header.
The name of the configmap containing the mail templates.
Mail templates that can be referenced by name on a variety of functional error scenario's.
Name of the mail template that can be referenced.
Mail message body. A limit degree of variable substitution is available.
Gemeentecode of the gemeente sending the zs-dms requests.
Application name used when sending the zs-dms requests.
Gemeentecode of the gemeente receiving the zs-dms requests.
Application name of the receiving zs-dms application.
Enable automatic retries. For all workflows(unless overriden).
Cron expression used for retry interval/schedule. For all workflows(unless overriden).
Maximum amount an errorstore item is retried. For all workflows(unless overriden).
Enable automatic retries. Override for this specific workflow.
Cron expression used for retry interval/schedule. Override for this specific workflow.
Maximum amount an errorstore item is retried. Override for this specific workflow.
Enable automatic retries. Override for this specific workflow.
Cron expression used for retry interval/schedule. Override for this specific workflow.
Maximum amount an errorstore item is retried. Override for this specific workflow.
Enable automatic retries. Override for this specific workflow.
Cron expression used for retry interval/schedule. Override for this specific workflow.
Maximum amount an errorstore item is retried. Override for this specific workflow.
Enable scheduled start the receiver of this specific workflow.
Cron expression used to schedule starting the receiver of this specific workflow.
Enable scheduled stop the receiver of this specific workflow.
Cron expression used to schedule stopping the receiver of this specific workflow.
Enable sending a mail to the form initiator when this specific error occurs.
Name of the mail template to be used when this specific error occurs.
Enable sending a mail to the form initiator when this specific error occurs.
Name of the mail template to be used when this specific error occurs.
Enable sending a mail to the form initiator when this specific error occurs.
Name of the mail template to be used when this specific error occurs.
The Frank!Framework will start with different settings enabled, depending on what DTAP stage is configured.
For more information about DTAP stages read:
notation has been changed. It is now possible to define a minimum and a maximum, and to set percentages.
is now required and should be set to the right stage. Read more in the
will default to the release namespace deployed in.

nameOverride.description: String to partially override common.names.fullname template (will maintain the release name)

fullnameOverride.description: String to fully override common.names.fullname template

tag.description: Frank!Framework image tag (immutable tags are recommended)

percentage.description: Set if the values for the memory are in percentages

minimum.description: Sets the initial size of the heap that will be used by the Frank!Framework

maximum.description: Sets the maximum size of the heap that will be used by the Frank!Framework

side.description: Set the `DTAP` side of where the instance is running

secret.description: Set the secret name of the existing secret

key.description: Set the key inside the secret that contains the data (e.g. `credentials.properties`)

name.description: Set the name of the Frank! instance (default is the `fullname`)

names.description: Set the configurations to load. Leave empty to use the default

certificateStores.description: Define certificate (key/trust) stores to mount in the resources folder of the Frank!

authentication.description: Set http authentication for the Frank!

localUsers.description: Set localUsers who can log in on the Frank!

baseDn.description: Set baseDn for Active Directory users

transactionManager.description: Set the transaction manager for Tomcat. Options: `NARAYANA`, `BTM`, ``

javaOpts.description: Append custom options to the `JAVA_OPTS` environment variable for the Frank!

create.description: Create a `context.xml` and possibly overwrite the existing one, to configure the connections/resources.

jdbc.description: Set multiple database connections. One connection should have an empty name, so it'll get picked up by default (unless `jdbc.required=false` is set)

replicaCount.description: Number of Frank!Framework replicas to deploy

enabled.description: Enable ingress record generation for Frank!

className.description: IngressClass that will be used to implement the Ingress (Kubernetes 1.18+)

annotations.description: Additional annotations for the Ingress resource. To enable certificate autogeneration, place here your cert-manager annotations.

tls.description: Define tls secrets for hosts (implementation not done yet)

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which pods are forcefully killed

timeZone.description: used for database connection and log timestamps

create.description: Enable creation of ServiceAccount for Frank!Framework pod

annotations.description: Additional custom annotations for the ServiceAccount

name.description: The name of the ServiceAccount to use.

enabled.description: Enable persistence using Persistent Volume Claims

existingClaim.description: The name of an existing PVC to use for persistence

selector.description: Selector to match an existing Persistent Volume for the Frank!Framework's data PVC

endpoint.description: Endpoint at which the zs-dms BeantwoordVraag binding is served.
Endpoint at which the zs-dms OntvangAsynchroon binding is served.
Endpoint at which the zs-dms VrijBericht binding is served.

rootUrl.description: Root url of the 'Notificaties API' that is used to subscribe at.

authType.description: Options: 'jwt', 'basic', 'value'. 'value' uses the password field of the given authAlias as Authorization header.

authAlias.description: Reference to an auth alias to be used as credentials for this api.

callback.description: Fully qualified url to the notification callback of openforms2xxllnc.

authAlias.description: Reference to an auth alias to be used as authorization key for calling the callback endpoint.

objectType.description: Url of the objecttype to filter the notifications on.

contents.description: A Helm chart for running ZaakBrug on Kubernetes
contents.name: zaakbrug
contents.title: Chart
🌉 ZaakBrug
contents.description: An app for Dutch municipalities that supports the transition from "zaak- en documentatieservices" (zds) to "zaakgericht werken" (zgw).

children.value: An app for Dutch municipalities that supports the transition from "zaak- en documentatieservices" (zds) to "zaakgericht werken" (zgw).

must be installed to use the charts.

The startup probe will enable blue-green deployment, which are great for uptime during upgrades and such.
It (and the liveness probe) will check if the console is accessible, until a better health endpoint is available.
The readiness probe will check if all adapters are running using the server health endpoint

Toggle probes. This should only be used if a Frank! needs to be kept while in a bad state (for debugging purposes)

The syntax for variable substitution is as follows {[variable-name]

id          Auto-incrementing identifier with 'D' as formatting option, indicating the amount of digits.
example: {id:D5} with id-123 will result in '00123'

datetime    The current date and time with '[Y' as formatting option, according to
(
Make sure that all Url's contain two "parts" e.g.
. Openzaak can't use a single part domain.

nameOverride.description: String to partially override ff-common.fullname template (will maintain the release name)

fullnameOverride.description: String to fully override ff-common.fullname template

tag.description: Frank!Framework image tag (immutable tags are recommended)

percentage.description: Set if the values for the memory are in percentages

minimum.description: Sets the initial size of the heap that will be used by the Frank!Framework

maximum.description: Sets the maximum size of the heap that will be used by the Frank!Framework

side.description: Set the `DTAP` side of where the instance is running

secret.description: Set the secret name of the existing secret

key.description: Set the key inside the secret that contains the data (e.g. `credentials.properties`)

name.description: Set the name of the Frank! instance (default is the `fullname`)

names.description: Set the configurations to load. Leave empty to use the default

certificateStores.description: Define certificate (key/trust) stores to mount in the resources folder of the Frank!

authentication.description: Set http authentication for the Frank!

localUsers.description: Set localUsers who can log in on the Frank!

baseDn.description: Set baseDn for Active Directory users

transactionManager.description: Set the transaction manager for Tomcat. Options: `NARAYANA`, `BTM`, ``

javaOpts.description: Append custom options to the `JAVA_OPTS` environment variable for the Frank!

create.description: Create a `context.xml` and possibly overwrite the existing one, to configure the connections/resources.

jdbc.description: Set multiple database connections. One connection should have an empty name, so it'll get picked up by default (unless `jdbc.required=false` is set)

replicaCount.description: Number of Frank!Framework replicas to deploy

enabled.description: Enable ingress record generation for Frank!

className.description: IngressClass that will be used to implement the Ingress (Kubernetes 1.18+)

annotations.description: Additional annotations for the Ingress resource. To enable certificate autogeneration, place here your cert-manager annotations.

tls.description: Define tls secrets for hosts (implementation not done yet)

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which pods are forcefully killed

timeZone.description: used for database connection and log timestamps

annotations.description: Additional custom annotations for the ServiceAccount

name.description: The name of the ServiceAccount to use.

enabled.description: Enable persistence using Persistent Volume Claims

existingClaim.description: The name of an existing PVC to use for persistence

selector.description: Selector to match an existing Persistent Volume for the Frank!Framework's data PVC
